key_insight: HiStream converts quadratic-cost diffusion video inference into an efficient streaming pipeline by eliminating spatial and temporal redundancy: denoise at low resolution, refine at high resolution with cached features, and process frames chunk-by-chunk to avoid repeated work.
problem_solved: Addresses the infeasibility of practical high-resolution video generation with diffusion models caused by quadratic compute and memory complexity during inference.
method: Autoregressive streaming framework that generates video in chunks to avoid reprocessing whole sequences.
Spatial compression: perform denoising at low resolution then upsample and refine at high resolution using cached features to skip redundant high-res denoising.
Feature caching and reuse across time and resolution to eliminate repeated computation and memory access during refinement.
impact: Makes high-resolution, film-quality video generation significantly faster and less memory-intensive, enabling practical deployment on constrained hardware and accelerating experimentation for ML researchers and engineers.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: low-res denoising → upsample + cached-feature refinement → output high-res frames (show data flow and caches).
Timeline/chunk streaming schematic: video divided into chunks with arrows showing chunk-by-chunk processing and overlap for temporal coherence.
Before/after bar chart: compute, memory, and latency comparison between standard diffusion inference and HiStream.
Iconic hardware visual: GPU + cache symbols showing reduced memory traffic and improved utilization.
paper_title: HiStream: Efficient High-Resolution Video Generation via Redundancy-Eliminated Streaming
paper_authors: Haonan Qiu, Shikun Liu, Zijian Zhou, Zhaochong An, Weiming Ren
